metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16539 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The DefaultLinuxSpec function in oci/defaults.go in Docker Moby through 17.03.2-ce does not block /proc/scsi pathnames, which allows attackers to trigger data loss (when certain older Linux kernels are used) by leveraging Docker container access to write a "scsi remove-single-device" line to /proc/scsi/scsi, aka SCSI MICDROP.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

docker.io - 18.06.1-0ubuntu1~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: docker.io package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '18.06.1-0ubuntu1~18.04.1').
